title: Electrical Engineer Job at African Natural Resources and Mines Limited
keyword: african natural resources and mines limited
content:
African Natural Resources and Mines Limited (ANRML), established by African Industries Group, operates a fully integrated iron ore mining and processing plant in Gujeni village, Kagarko LGA, Kaduna state—the first of its kind in Nigeria.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Electrical Engineer
Job Location: Kaduna
Employment Type: Full-time

Description
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	The Electrical Engineer is responsible for the maintenance, troubleshooting, and improvement of electrical systems and equipment within the pellet plant.
	The role supports continuous and safe plant operations by ensuring high equipment availability, energy efficiency, and compliance with safety and regulatory standards.


Key Responsibilities


	Plan and execute preventive, corrective, and predictive maintenance of electrical equipment such as MCCs, motors, VFDs, switchgear, transformers, lighting systems, and control panels.
	Monitor plant electrical systems and resolve issues to minimize downtime and ensure stable plant operations.
	Lead troubleshooting efforts on electrical faults and coordinate with instrumentation and mechanical teams for integrated problem-solving.
	Support the installation and commissioning of new electrical systems or equipment upgrades.
	Prepare and maintain technical documentation, maintenance records, and reports.
	Assist in the planning and execution of shutdown maintenance and turnarounds.
	Identify opportunities for energy efficiency and propose improvements to reduce power consumption.


Qualifications and Skills


	Bachelor’s Degree in Electrical Engineering from a recognized institution.
	3 - 5 years of experience in electrical maintenance, preferably in a pellet plant or heavy process industry.
	Strong knowledge of industrial power systems, motor control centers, variable frequency drives (VFDs), and PLC systems.
	Familiarity with national and international electrical codes (e.g., IEC, NEC).
	Proficiency in electrical troubleshooting, reading schematics, and using diagnostic tools.
	Experience with Computerized Maintenance Management Systems (CMMS) like SAP or Maximo is an advantage.
	Good analytical, communication, and team coordination skills.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: george.mathew@anrml.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

title: Inventory Officer Job at Kkon Technologies
content:
Kkon Technologies stands as an Open Access Network provider with a dedicated focus on Fiber To The Business (FTTB) and metro wireless radio service, aiming to establish flawless fiber and radio connectivity for numerous businesses throughout the country.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Inventory Officer
Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Contract

Job Summary
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	The Inventory Officer is responsible for managing and overseeing all aspects of the store inventory management, including stock control, storage, and issuance of materials.
	This involves maintaining optimal stock levels, tracking inventory, ensuring the accuracy of inventory records, and implementing measures to minimize stockouts as well as prevent excess stocking.
	The Inventory Officer will work closely with various departments to ensure smooth operations and efficient supply chain management.


Responsibilities


	Receive, inspect, and record incoming materials, verifying quantity, quality, and condition against purchase orders.
	Monitor and control inventory levels, track stock movements, and conduct regular stock counts to ensure accuracy of inventory records.
	Update inventory ERP systems to reflect stock transactions, adjustments, and movements accurately.
	Investigate and resolve discrepancies in inventory records promptly.
	Coordinate with procurement teams to place orders for replenishment stock, ensuring timely delivery and availability of inventory items.
	Prepare and present weekly inventory reports showing summaries of receipts, issuances, opening stock, closing balance, stock variances, and other required documentation.
	Collaborate with other departments to forecast inventory needs, plan accordingly, and implement inventory control procedures and best practices.
	Maintain compliance with organizational policies, safety standards, and regulatory requirements related to inventory management.


Salary
N100,000 - N150,000 Monthly.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their resume to: careers@fob.ng using Job Position as the subject of the mail.
